llm: Lua is a powerful, efficient, lightweight, embeddable scripting language. It supports procedural programming, object-oriented programming, functional programming, data-driven programming, and data description. Lua is commonly used for game development, web applications, scripting, and embedded systems. It is also used as a general-purpose, stand-alone language.

Lua was created in 1993 by Roberto Ierusalimschy, Luiz Henrique de Figueiredo, and Waldemar Celes, all members of the Computer Graphics Technology Group at the Pontifical Catholic University of Rio de Janeiro in Brazil.

user: was it funded by the church?
llm: No, Lua was not funded by the church. It was developed as part of the Computer Graphics Technology Group's research project.

user: doesnt the church fund that university?
llm: No, the Pontifical Catholic University of Rio de Janeiro is not funded by the church. It is a private university that receives funding from tuition fees, research grants, and donations.
